website_summaries.verdict: Top choice for green wipes that use only natural ingredients.
pros: Most users appreciate how soft, durable, and thick these wipes are
They also stand out for having a good moisture level and cleaning sensitive skin without over drying
cons: A few felt the cost was too high
occasional users commented on them being stiff or linty

customer_reviews.title: Quality has gone down! DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using Seventh Generation wipes for a long time. The past few shipments I have received have been MUCH lower quality than they used to be. The pill up all over my baby’s butt when I use them to wipe him. What is the point of a wipe if I have to clean little bits of wipe off after using it? Very, very disappointed in Seventh Generation. I am looking for a suitable, natural replacement and will update when I find a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Hotdog

customer_reviews.title: Stick together
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these religiously since I have have kids (almost 3 years) and now all of a sudden they all stick together. I go for one wipe and I get 7 all stuck together. I’ve never had that problem with the wipes before. And it’s a horrible inconvenience. I’m hoping to find a better all natural wipe out there
customer_reviews.author: kate s.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible.
customer_reviews.text: Awful. Sudsy, rough, and leaves bits and pieces absolutely everywhere. It’s my first time using these wipes and I genuinely wish I hadn’t bought this large box because they are absolutely the worst wipes I have ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Swigart

customer_reviews.title: Great sensitive skin wipe
customer_reviews.text: Love these wipes. I used huggies wipes for my first baby but wanted to give a more natural wipe a try for my second kid. These are GREAT every wipe is super moist, I’ve never had one tear, and usually one wipe does the trick for a diaper change. I’ve even used to remove my makeup and they dont burn my face at all. Really impressed with these.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Short one package
customer_reviews.text: The three stars isn’t for the wipes themselves—they are great! I simply ordered the value box and it only had 11 packages of wipes vs the 12 it was to have.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica A M Basala

customer_reviews.title: Flip tops don’t shut and aren’t perforated at top.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve got a whole box of wipes that aren’t perforated so I can’t even open the package properly. I have to go through and slice all of them. Also, almost all the flip tops don’t shut properly and will cause the wipes to dry out.. I’ve never had issues the many orders I’ve placed before. What’s the convenience in that? I’m so disappointed Seventh Generation.
customer_reviews.author: THE Goddess

customer_reviews.title: You need these. They're everything a baby wipe should be
customer_reviews.text: So I took a chance on these. I am a penny pincher mom who also tries to buy good for my baby and environment products. I usually just buy the aloe Parents choice wipes from Walmart because they're cheap and work well and don't bother his skin any. These are a game changer! They are so thick! The packaging is way better! It actually snaps closed well! And then they're seventh gen, so you know they're a good product. Totally worth the extra cents per wipe! I will not be buying any other diapers unless I'm low on money lol
customer_reviews.author: Gracie

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: So far I'm really liking these wipes. My toddler has had sensitive skin since a newborn. I can't use just any wipes on him. Compared to other brands I've bought (Pampure Pure, Huggies) these wipes are moist enough, soft yet thick enough they won't rip as I wipe. They also aren't super soaked wipes, it leaves my kiddos bum very clean but not wet. I gave 5 stars on scent because it has no scent and that's exactly what it says and what I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: good substitute for our normal wipes
customer_reviews.text: We were having a hard time finding wipes, and I was pleasantly surprised by these. The biggest difference between these and our usual is that the wipe is thicker than our normal ones, which is great for heavy duty messes. Also, they are significantly more wet than our usual wipes. This could be useful, but I gave my little one a bit of a fan dry with the new diaper before putting it on so she wouldn't have chafing.
customer_reviews.author: J B

customer_reviews.title: They could be better!
customer_reviews.text: Don't get me wrong, I love Seventh Generation products but I don't love these baby wipes. They're okay but they could be better. They are great for sensitive skin, there's no smell, they're soft, and I like that you can use these wipes on anything. What I don't like is they leave behind debris like pieces of the wipe rubs off. I also don't like that the wipes aren't stretchy but a little stiff. At least the softness kinda makes up for the stiffness!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Gold

customer_reviews.title: Great for dirty dog paws
customer_reviews.text: We use these to wipe our dog's paws when he comes in from a walk. They seem to be taking off much more dirt than the Huggies brand wipes we were using before. They're unscented, which is great, and they're strong. I feel a little bad about the packaging, which is plastic with a hard plastic cover, but it does snap shut and does a really good job keeping them moist.
customer_reviews.author: L. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: I love that these wipes are safe for my baby and do not have a strong scent. They are thick and durable, which I love because they don’t rip when wiping the baby. The packaging is easy to use and allows for one wipe to come out at a time vs some wipes where I feel like I would be frustrated trying to separate them to just use one wipe.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren D.

customer_reviews.title: Best I've Ever Used
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to leave a review because I didn't want others to buy them all up! Then I thought that was stupid and selfish, so I can now say how much I LOVE these wipes...for myself! They're unscented, soft, large enough for my use, and thick. I bought a case because when I was trying to find wipes, there weren't any locally and barely online when the pandemic just broke out. Everything was being bought up and hoarded by many panicked and, yes, corrupt people. So glad I got them. They're great!
customer_reviews.author: Babs

customer_reviews.title: Love ❤️
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. My baby’s skin likes these wipes. They’re better than expected!
customer_reviews.author: Chris Jackson

customer_reviews.title: Surprised by the great quality
customer_reviews.text: I've gotta say, I hate their diapers, but these wipes are great! Faced with 'Rona shortages, I reluctantly ordered a couple boxes of these. We normally buy Huggies brand. These wipes are thicker and softer and the packages are much more sturdy. Not once has the lid on a bag fallen off (which often happens with other brands. The only negative is that the first wipe is a bit difficult to pull out. After that, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Thew

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Great product without all the unneeded bad chemicals. I even use them on faces! I'd give them 5 stars only I think the texture could be improved on. They are perfectly smooth and I think wipes with some texture to the surface seem to clean bottoms better. But they are moist enough and thick enough. I hate really thin wipes and these are good. I now buy only these or Honest company wipes. I love the texture of theirs but overall I think I still like these the best and they are cheaper then Honeset Co. too.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Great wipes, wish that there was less packaging.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these wipes for babies. Very soft, keep their moisture well, and don't tear or fall apart. Also, no scent! The only problem I have is that Seventh Generation packages them with an unnecessary plastic flip-cap. I always transfer the packets of wipes to a reusable dispenser, so that extra plastic is just wasted.
customer_reviews.author: PFB

customer_reviews.title: The best wipes
customer_reviews.text: I have four children and believe me I have tried all of the wipes in the worldAnd by far these are the best the size is perfect they are thick And they really clean will you don’t have to use as many fbecuase you can clean so well with this one These are my favorite ones once you try them We can’t go back to another brand
customer_reviews.author: Anna V

customer_reviews.title: Works well but feels weird
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because the brand I typically buy were out of stock of all their products. These wipes has mixed reviews but I decided to buy them anyways because they were the cheapest option at the time. The wipes do work well, but they feel as if they have soap on them. Even my husband noticed a difference with these wipes. We won't be purchasing these again because we prefer the other brand more.
customer_reviews.author: Owen

customer_reviews.title: Caused rash; give it a try but don't commit to this giant box!
customer_reviews.text: My kids have sensitive skin, I could only use honest co and water wipes in the past without them getting diaper rash. I was looking for a cheaper alternative in a flip top but these gave my baby a rash (face, butt). I exclusively use 1 type of wipe at a time to eliminate confusion about what caused the rash. I have since moved on to pampers sensitive wipes and so far okay. I also felt like these fell apart more easily and were not as durable for wiping. I won't be buying again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Cha

customer_reviews.title: Ok wipe for standard use
customer_reviews.text: These wipes are useful and clean well. The only 2 things I don't like about them are they are maybe a little too wet for my liking in comparison to some other wipes. Also we have them in a wipe warmer and they are always sticking together! They don't separate very easily. It's kind of a pain when you only want 1 wipe. All in all though they are decent.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse

customer_reviews.title: Works and smells good
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these wipes during the pandemic . They work great . They smell good not like some wipes . I’m I use them for my toddler . Mostly to wipe her hands down or to clean up a sticky mess she makes
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: With the new formulation, look no further!
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for good wipes that don't contain all the chemicals of traditional wipes and are affordable, these are it. As the box says they don't contain phenoxyethanol. Which is something hard to find, even in some of the "natural" wipes. Water Wipes were too wet, Honest Co are too expensive (even in "bulk"), Babyganics were too thin and others still had a lot of chemicals. Not to mention every pack has a flip top lid which is awesome.
customer_reviews.author: A&MW11

customer_reviews.title: Worst wipes I’ve ever bought!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: These wipes literally make me angry to use them. You wouldn’t think anger would be the first word but these wipes make the process sooo much more miserable. They DO NOT come apart. You cannot find the perforation to just grab one. They are thick which makes it hard to feel how much you’ve wipes and they ripe easily. The film that is left On the skin is like the wipes are filled wish soap. I will never buy them again. They make me so mad when I have to fiddle with them so long. I’ll never buy anything but Costco wipes ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not soft at all
customer_reviews.text: Despite good reviews by others, I am very disappointed in these wipes. They are not soft at all. Also, while there is practically no scent, when I put them under running water, I see bubbles, which tells me there is some kind of soap added. I much prefer the Amazon brand wipes but it's very hard to catch them in stock.
customer_reviews.author: Lena

customer_reviews.title: No babies right now.
customer_reviews.text: I was thrilled that these were available. They came quickly and are a high quality wipe. I spike the individual packets with 99%isopropyl to add to the usefulness when I need grocery store wipes. I leave them unspiked for general wiping up. I have no babies right now. Maybe I use them inappropriately but they work.
customer_reviews.author: Mommiesalame

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but smells like...
customer_reviews.text: My wife did quite a bit of research on wipes before settling on these. We've had our first box for a couple of weeks now and my wife has been using them on the baby. I used one for the first time and was appalled with the scent, smells just like spit. My wife said she thought it was just her until I said it tonight. We love the safe ingredients and how well they work, but can't handle the "spit" smell. We won't be buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not soft but still gentle and won’t fall apart
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve tried pampers wipes, honest wipes and these. I like that the wipe stays in one piece unlike pampers. The solution is great for sensitive skin and doesn’t smell. The wipe itself is a bit thick so don’t push to hard when wiping the skin, similar to honest company’s wipes. Overall I’m happy with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Best Wipes to use !
customer_reviews.text: I use these wipes for my newborn and I absolutely love them and prefer them over the Pampers sensitive wipes. These wipes have just the right amount of wetness to them and I don't have to use alot to get the job done. It also doesn't shed from being too dry like the others. Clean wipes and I'm done changing his diaper alot faster. Will continue to buy these instead .
customer_reviews.author: Marianita Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Great for sensitive skin!
customer_reviews.text: I have used these through 2 kids, both with extremely sensitive skin (eczema). Very soft, fragrance free, and sturdy enough to get everything cleaned in the diaper area. These wipes are also gentle enough that they don’t irritate either of my kids. I love the packages with the plastic topper, and I always gift these to new moms at their baby shower! These are awesome awesome awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Caused a bad, red, diaper  rash!
customer_reviews.text: My baby is 4 months old and never had a diaper wash until using this product. We believe these wipes caused a severe diaper rash. We really wanted to like this brand so gave them a second chance. We waited until all rash healed and then started using them again. Rash was back on the second day. Still not sure what will we do with the rest of the wipes!!!!!!!!!!!! So keep in mind this before buying bulk of this wipes .
customer_reviews.author: O.Ak

customer_reviews.title: The continuous feed is not a continuous feed
customer_reviews.text: I mostly love these wipes, but lately the continuous feed is not working. I know that sounds like not a big deal, but when you've got a baby's feet in one hand and are trying to keep their hands out of the blowout they just created, it's the absolute worst to have to pause everything and go digging for the next wipe. This isn't something that just happens every now and then either, it happens probably 3 out of 5 wipes. I'll be looking for a new brand of sensitive skin wipes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best All-Around Baby Wipe
customer_reviews.text: I have tried pretty much every wipe on the market, and these are by far my favorite. They are thick, durable, fragrance free, and I feel good about using them on my children with sensitive skin. We avoid chemicals, and I’m pleased with these wipes compared to the other comparable natural-minded baby wipes out there.
customer_reviews.author: Alissa G

customer_reviews.title: Harsher than expected
customer_reviews.text: My favorite brand for wipes is Amazon’s, but they ran out and these were available. These are much rougher. In fact, they seem to me to cause redness rather than clean well. When we’ve used them up, I won’t buy again — unless there is still a stock shortage and I’m desperate.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa K.

customer_reviews.title: Good but not as soft as Walmart and Sam's club brand
customer_reviews.text: These definitely wipe baby butts pretty well. I decided to give them 3 stars because they aren't very soft. I'm used to using the sensitive skin Walmart and members mark brand from Sam's club. Those have sensitive dots that help wipe better and are much softer to the touch.
customer_reviews.author: Micah Ferrell

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these wipes. So far I’ve also tried Babyganics (my son was only born a month ago) and they’re too thin in my opinion. These have a pleasant smell, are thick enough to wipe enough usually only with one wipe, and are a decent price for natural wipes. I would definitely recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Carlisle

customer_reviews.title: Great for Babies and CPAPs!
customer_reviews.text: This product lacks any chemical smelling scent which very nice since I use it to clean my CPAP mask. I really enjoy how moist the wipes are compared to generic brands. I also approve of the strength of the wipe, my fingers don't break through when using it and I don't need more than one to wipe off the entire mask. I think use as baby wipes for babies, parents would be overly satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary

customer_reviews.title: Costco look out.  These wipes are almost as good as your Kirkland brand.  Recommended buy!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for the first time when Costco wipes were sold out during the Corona Virus outbreak. Very surprised at the overall quality and feel. It is not as thick at the Costco wipes but it’s good enough. Would definitely purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Petrosar

customer_reviews.title: Okay
customer_reviews.text: Good enough. Nice and thick, no sensitivity issues and don't dry out fast. They just tend to leave little beads of fabric on baby's skin which gets annoying.(looks like the fabric pills that sweaters get)
customer_reviews.author: SJC

customer_reviews.title: Cotton sheds
customer_reviews.text: I wish the wipes were a little more moist but the biggest issue for me was that the cotton sheds. I don’t remember this being an issues a year ago. I’ve used these wipes in the past but have been using water wipes for the last year. I thought I would give these a try again but the cotton pieces left behind drive me crazy. I will be buying water wipes again.
customer_reviews.author: Rebekah Hammang

customer_reviews.title: Best ones on the market!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best wipes! I'm interested in a more natural product and have tried several brands, but these seem to be the best ones. They are thick and sturdy. We use them for everything, on anything. Kids are dirty, clean it up... baby wipes. Pro tip: make sure you get the Flip-Top. The other closure doesn't work well and the wipes dry out. On a side note, if you're thinking its a match made in heaven, think again.... 7th Gen diapers wouldn't be worth it at half the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wipes are very stiff
customer_reviews.text: I typically use Water Wipes, but wanted to try and use a wipe that still met my standards of no chemicals, dyes, bleach etc. These Seventh Generation wipes were significantly cheaper than Water Wipes, so I thought I’d give them a try. They still do the job of wiping everhthe jung clean, however the wipes are not soft at all! They are so hard! The other downside of these wipes, is that you can’t just pull one out of the package.... she then your shoving 1-2 wipes back in the package to close it. I was so sad these wipes didn’t turn out better. I will switch back to water wipes.
customer_reviews.author: GB Mama

customer_reviews.title: Caused terrible allergic reaction
customer_reviews.text: Although my 3 year old has not had an issue, my 6 month old had a terrible reaction to these wipes. Looks like a burn on his skin. We usually use Water Wipes and he’s never had an issue. I’m very upset that this product causes such a terrible allergic reaction.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lid doesn’t stay closed
customer_reviews.text: Like the Thickness of the wipes and the fact that they are sensitive. However the flip top lid doesn’t stay closed and many wipes dry out. In addition, when you’re grabbing one wipe, sometimes Two or three come out, and it wastes wipes. The fliptop design mechanism is very annoying. I have found Pampers sensitive to be much easier to use and the lid stays closed. Very annoying and I will be going back to pampers sensitive after this box.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie G

customer_reviews.title: Love em
customer_reviews.text: We have used the 7th generation wipes since my daughter was born. We also tried Honest wipes and a few other natural ones. The 7th Gen work the best. They don't rip and have the perfect feel to them. The only neg is they can be a tad hard to get out of the container one handed.
customer_reviews.author: BigD38

customer_reviews.title: dry out quick
customer_reviews.text: Standard baby wipe... we use about 50 a day but with these you have to make sure the container is completely closed or you will lose all the moisture in the pack. When they dry out, even just a little, it becomes much harder to clean a baby butt. I wouldn't get these again.
customer_reviews.author: BethandZac

customer_reviews.title: Was available when nothing else was
customer_reviews.text: While the price is steep compared to the cheapo’s are usually buy, this box was available when nothing else was in turned out to be a product I love. Very easy on my daughters skin but gets the job done.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Product has changed. Not happy.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very upset that these have changed. I have had a subscription for years for Seventh Generation Original Soft and Gentle Free and Clear Baby Wipes. Suddenly with my latest delivery these wipes are completely different. Too thick, they get stuck together, and so wet! Im really unhappy that I have a whole case of these to get through.
customer_reviews.author: JennDiego

customer_reviews.title: Expensive wipes but they're great
customer_reviews.text: I think I've tried almost every wipe available. Costco brand is great for the value but half the wipes at the top of the package are not as damp as the bottom. These do not have that issue. They are ALL damp. Every wipe.
customer_reviews.author: Alice

customer_reviews.title: Change is not always good.
customer_reviews.text: I received a new box of these wipes. When I opened them I realized they changed the packing. I didn’t think much of it until I pulled a wipe out. Not only have they started making the wiles themselves SMALLER, they are also THINNER then what they had originally. I as am extremely disappointed as I have been using these wipes for over two years. I feel like I have to go and search for a new wipe to fit our needs.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Cain-Shreiner

customer_reviews.title: Not what i expected.....
customer_reviews.text: Definitely not what I was expecting for $30 worth of wipes. At the beginning of the Pandemic I had to get these wipes instead of what I usually get and I was actually very happy with them. They where thick with alot of moisture. The $30 wipes in a small pack from Amazon was thin and dry. And so I am unhappy with the amount of money I wasted on wipes that won't last long.
customer_reviews.author: Tamii and Scott

customer_reviews.title: My favorite wipes!
customer_reviews.text: These are by far my favorite wipes. They are thick and great on sensitive skin. They do not leave behind little fibers as many wipes do. These will continue to be my go-to for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Erin M

customer_reviews.title: NO GOOD
customer_reviews.text: The nurses said these weren't thick like the regular wipes I purchase for mom. They said they were falling apart as they use them. So I won't be buying these anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great deal. 12 packs for $22. I usually pay $36! That's a huge difference. The packaging is different but the product is the exact same. I prefer this packaging, actually.
customer_reviews.author: Elie

customer_reviews.title: The best baby wipes!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite baby wipes. They are so soft and durable. You use less wipes when clean up your little ones and they are great for sensitive skin. I love the natural ingredients and I love that they have the flip top for when on the go.
customer_reviews.author: Justin and Heather

customer_reviews.title: The flip top is great because not many wipes have that feature
customer_reviews.text: I used to only use these wipes. The flip top is great because not many wipes have that feature. They never dry out. But I’m not a fan anymore. They leave a fiber residue all over anything you wipe them down with (baby, clothes, tables, toys) they smell and taste bad. No baby wants a gross taste in their mouth when you’re wiping it. The deal is great but definitely not a fan anymore.
customer_reviews.author: «natural mama»

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I actually bought these for my puppy that had double knee surgery. I love them and now other family members are using them as well. I'll never go back to puppy wipes.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca E.

customer_reviews.title: Good job cleaning
customer_reviews.text: They clean well and don’t leave any poo behind or fuzz from the wipe. They are very thick so not as soft as other brands. They pull out of the package well and don’t often get stuck to one another (pull more than one out at a time). They stayed fresh.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie P.

customer_reviews.title: Poor packaging
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been ordering this product since my son was born and have loved them. They have always come with a white plastic lid that snaps the wipes closed ...keeping them moist and sanitary. I received my case the other day with these flimsy peel seal ..that most of them end up falling off..and drying out the wipes . I have to keep putting them in zip lock bags . Very disappointed with this packaging ..especially since I bought a whole case
customer_reviews.author: Daniel J. Altieri

customer_reviews.title: Meh, I prefer Honest Wipes. These leave lint.
customer_reviews.text: I prefer to use natural wipes because my baby gets red even with the sensitive version of pampers or huggies etc. I liked that the wipes were thick and obviously have no chemicals and such, but the wipes leaves fibers and wet lint on my babies butt which I'm not so fond of. I prefer Honest Wipes above all others because of the texture and strength of the wipes.
customer_reviews.author: Sara W.

customer_reviews.title: Expensive but great quality
customer_reviews.text: I really liked using these wipes! They are thick and moist. Great on baby’s skin! I would buy another box if they weren’t so expensive
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: They are sturdy, they clean very well and you only need one or two. Yes, they are expensive but they are wet enough and you End up using about half compared to the cheaper wipes.
customer_reviews.author: Lils Reyes

customer_reviews.title: They Are AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: I love these!! They lasted me for almost 2 whole months! I was buying the boxes of Pampers wipes like every 3 weeks for the same price! These are thicker and I don’t have to use as much! Only reason I’m canceling the subscription is that My toddler just turned 2 and is getting potty trained I WISH I knew about these 3 kids ago! Best switch I did!
customer_reviews.author: Daniela  Perez

customer_reviews.title: Durable Wipes
customer_reviews.text: These wipes are excellent! I have bought them since day one after sampling many different brands. They are very thick and strong without letting off a chemical odor. They get the job done with less wipes so I am willing to pay the extra price for the quality.
customer_reviews.author: Laura S.

customer_reviews.title: Love the new packaging!
customer_reviews.text: Love these and the new packaging! The clasp on the front of each package makes it very convenient to close. I used to have a a wipe dispenser so they wouldn't get dried out but I finally threw it away after 7 years of having babies. Also like that they don't have a bunch of crap materials in them for peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: Kris

customer_reviews.title: Please fix the flip-tops
customer_reviews.text: The wipes work great and I love that they are soft and don't irritate sensitive baby skin, but I wish the flip-tops worked better. Only 1 package had a working flip-top, the rest of them don't stay closed and the wipes lose moisture and get dry and stiff.
customer_reviews.author: machupo

customer_reviews.title: Sensitive Family Favorite
customer_reviews.text: The only wipes that my 4 super sensitive kids have never broke out from and the quality of the wipes is SO much better than some “competitors!”
customer_reviews.author: SchoepFam11

customer_reviews.title: Best wipes!
customer_reviews.text: I love these wipes. They are thick, and don’t have any fragrances that my kids have reacted to. I’ve been using them on all 5 of my babies. The only complaint is that they do not come out very easily. They stick together, so you do end up using more or wasting more wipes. But, it’s the best brand I’ve tried, so I’m willing to put up with that inconvenience!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality brand!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty expensive but it’s worth it for the time I needed them couldn’t find a big pack of diapers Or wipes anywhere ! Individually packaged for on the go .
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn Major

customer_reviews.title: Caused bad diaper rash
customer_reviews.text: These gave my son a terrible diaper rash within 5 days of using these exclusively. He’s only had 1 or 2 other diaper rashes in his 13 months but I could tell something seemed a bit off when I wiped and his little bottom was still damp. These were the only change in our diapering routine, back to our old brand.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best wipes so far
customer_reviews.text: I like these wipes because you can easily rip them in half and use what you need. My favourite wipes by far
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love the thickness!
customer_reviews.text: Love them. Cant use the same one for too long (like cleaning your face) because the fibers will come off onto your skin. However, that's not necessarily a bad thing because that just means the wipes are more biodegradable than its competitor (Huggies wipes). They are exactly the same as Huggies wipes except seventh generation wipes are more biodegradable.
customer_reviews.author: JCole

customer_reviews.title: I know they are thick wipes but...
customer_reviews.text: They seem drenched. If you were to squeeze out these wipes a lot of fluid would secrete out of them. That is a formula for a rash :(
customer_reviews.author: Arthur

customer_reviews.title: Dry
customer_reviews.text: Super dry & leaves the white "tissue marks" on my babies bottom. They are thick though if your looking for a thick wipe.
customer_reviews.author: Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great wipes.
customer_reviews.text: A little hard to open package and annoying when wipes stick together and won’t pull out individually one handed. Love that you can use these on face too.
customer_reviews.author: True Reader

customer_reviews.title: Love this product and the company
customer_reviews.text: My daughter has not had a rash since I started these at one month old (she's four months old)....the chemicals and additives in other brands are what make babies break out. It really does matter what we use with their sensitive skin! Love this product and the company....I've started switching over a lot of things I use to this brand. Will only Use these wipes!
customer_reviews.author: Deenie

customer_reviews.title: Fave wipes
customer_reviews.text: I looe these. I have been going through different wipe brands to find the ones we like best and I think its this brand. The wipes dont stick together as much as other brands and they do their job of wiping!
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Ricke

customer_reviews.title: Mehhh..
customer_reviews.text: It’s a decent wipe but it gets to soaking wet towards the bottom. It feels weird on the butt. Should stick with Costco brand wet wipes.
customer_reviews.author: carol z.

customer_reviews.title: Best wipes!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best wipes. We have tried a few different brands, but these ones are our favorite. The flip top keeps the water in the package and not all over my diaper bag, its easily torn off at the end and recycled. We use less of these wipes per diaper change than other brands, and coupons for them are easier to come by. They also don't have much of a smell to them, which I appreciate.
customer_reviews.author: TheHadleyHome

customer_reviews.title: Best wipes
customer_reviews.text: I've used these wipes for 22 months on my son and they are definitely my favorites. He has never had a rash in his life
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Flip top packaging is better than big box ones, best wipes money can buy
customer_reviews.text: Great wipes, used a lot of other natural wipes and these are the best. Thick sheets, minimal ingredients, sensitive on babies skin. Cheap with subscribe and save. These are nicer than the big box ones too that sell the same ones because those are the peel and restick openings, these ones have a click plastic flip top on every package.
customer_reviews.author: Primer

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: My son is 10 years old and is special needs. He has been in diapers 24/7 since birth. Some wipes have given his sensitive skin rashes, or didn’t hold up to big boy poops but these rock! Being that we go though A LOT of wipes, I feel a little less guilty about it when using these!
customer_reviews.author: A. Garin

customer_reviews.title: Dry and rough
customer_reviews.text: I found them dry and rough. I use a diaper warmer and they seem to soak up all the water and still feel dry. I prefer the Honest brand.
customer_reviews.author: Green

customer_reviews.title: Wipes leave prices behind
customer_reviews.text: While I found these to be comparable at a price per wipe versus other name brands, I was disappointed in the quality of the wipe itself. These wipes leave little pieces behind and tear too easily. However, other than that, i found they were gentle enough to use on my LO’s sensitive skin.
customer_reviews.author: Multitasking Momma

customer_reviews.title: Great brand!
customer_reviews.text: Love this brand! Soft and gentle on skin! I do wish the dispenser bags came with a better open and close method. I put my bag of wipes in a zip block baggie to keep them from drying out!
customer_reviews.author: Abigail

customer_reviews.title: Good for the job, don’t seperate on their own
customer_reviews.text: They are a good thickness but they stick together when pulling them out, which isn’t super handy, so I usually take several out ahead of taking the diaper off, so I don’t get a long bunch of them attached together when I’m trying to wipe up some poo! Lol
customer_reviews.author: Jenni

customer_reviews.title: Best we've tried
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several different baby wipes and both my husband and I prefer this one above all the others. They're thick, easy to tear (when you want to make smaller pieces) and are absorbent. They also have a decent smell. I get these as a subscribe and save item.
customer_reviews.author: M. T.

customer_reviews.title: so gentle
customer_reviews.text: they are so gentle, i use them for so much. makeup removal, cleaning surfaces (not a disinfectant but it leaves the surface looking clean anyway), and of course the usual use. love these wipes so much
customer_reviews.author: BRT

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but leave lint behind
customer_reviews.text: Not as good as a previous version. These leave a lot of lint, which was why I previously preferred the "free and clear" to the "thick and strong." I'm not sure if they've merged these two products, or if the non-linty ones have just been out of stock. I've now changed to Target wipes and diapers, which are much cheaper and aren't linty.
customer_reviews.author: rachel

customer_reviews.title: Favorite wipes
customer_reviews.text: I love these wipes! I love that I can use them on my babies hands, face, and bottom. They don't rip when using them. The only little thing that I don't like is more than one wipe comes out when trying to take out one. It's not that big of deal, but can be annoying when you only want one wipe!
customer_reviews.author: AWcool

customer_reviews.title: Bad smell
customer_reviews.text: I think they're nice as a wipe, but the smell is strong and yucky!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Lysol

customer_reviews.title: Decent but won’t purchase again.
customer_reviews.text: These are great for babies with sensitive skin. The down side is the texture is like a wet paper towel and not a soft one. They are really rough in comparison to brands such as Honest and Hello Bello.
customer_reviews.author: Catie

customer_reviews.title: The best wipes
customer_reviews.text: I’ve tried several wipe brands, these are the best. They are durable, thick, and have more moisture than others. One wipe of these is as good as three wipes from competitors
customer_reviews.author: Christina Lind

customer_reviews.title: Good wipes
customer_reviews.text: One if my prefered baby wipes. Doesn't smell like alcohol or anything, thick, works good for us.
customer_reviews.author: Luna

customer_reviews.title: Get these wipes!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love! No sensitivity on baby’s bum, they done tear apart like huggies wipes do and they are nice and thick. Will only buy these wipes from here on out and I suggest you do the same!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My favorite wipes
customer_reviews.text: Love these wipes. Best I've found so far. Not too small, not too big, just moist enough and I feel good about the ingredients in them.
customer_reviews.author: Chicco

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Love love love these wipes. Not too thick or thin and not too wet or dry. Perfect for my baby girl
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Will

customer_reviews.title: Lovr my new Blom!
customer_reviews.text: Love this Blom Beau Tie. It is just as great as the original one if not better. I like the fact that I can tie it and adjust it in different ways. I can wear it all day long and don't have a headache. It is practical yet stylish and cute.
customer_reviews.author: Rebeca

customer_reviews.title: Weirdly linty batch.
customer_reviews.text: We buy these all the time but have noticed that the last batch is kind of linty. I wiped my son's face this morning and the wipe left a trail of lint everywhere. But that doesn't always happen so perhaps it's just a strange batch.
customer_reviews.author: Dog Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Strong and thick =less mess on mommy!
customer_reviews.text: Best wipes. For our baby shower we received an assortment of branded wipes. These are THE BEST. They are thick and strong, I get less mess on myself, and baby cleans up great. Love that is has zero fragrances and dyes. And you can buy these at most local grocery stores if needed. Now that I have used up all the other brands from our baby shower we will be consistent and loyal Seventh Generstion baby wipe users!
customer_reviews.author: Erin Mank

product_meta.title: Seventh Generation Baby Wipes, Free & Clear Unscented and Sensitive, Gentle as Water, with Flip Top Dispenser, 768 count (Packaging May Vary)
product_meta.description: Size:768 Count| Style:WipesSmooth, soft, and clean – the way a baby’s bottom should be. Seventh Generation Free & Clear sensitive Baby Wipes are made for baby’s sensitive skin and contain 0% fragrance, alcohol, parabens, or phenoxyethanol. Our thick, soft wipes are strong enough for big messes while being gentle on newborn baby’s most precious, delicate skin. These unscented baby wipes are moistened with plant-derived skin conditioners like aloe vera and are safe for baby, hands, and face. The flip-top package design locks in moisture to keep wet wipes fresh and allow for easy, on-the-go dispensing. Our hypoallergenic and fragrance free wipes are dermatologist tested and clinically proven to be gentle on baby’s skin. It’s all good, baby. Caring for a little human is a magical undertaking, and we’ve developed an entire line of unscented baby wipes, and baby diapers to bring peace of mind to your journey. For every life-changing milestone, you deserve the right diaper, the right diaper wipes, and baby care you can trust. Caring today for the next seven generations. At Seventh Generation we do business differently. We believe our products are healthy solutions for use within your home–and for the community and environment outside of it. We are always evaluating how to reduce their environmental impact, increase performance and safety, and create a more sustainable supply chain. We believe it is our responsibility to set a course for a more mindful way of doing business, where companies act as partners with other stakeholders to create a brighter future for the whole planet. Seventh Generation is proud to be a Certified B Corporation. B Corps are certified to be better for workers, better for communities, and better for the environment. By choosing Seventh Generation products, you’re joining us in nurturing the health of the next seven generations.
feature_bullets: Seventh generation free and clear sensitive baby wipes are made for your child's sensitive skin
Thick and soft baby wipes for a gentle clean that is safe for baby, hands, and fACe
Our unscented baby wipes are fragrance free, alcohol free, paraben free, and phenoxyethanol free
Hypoallergenic and dermatologist tested, these sensitive wipes are perfect for your baby
Easy dispensing flip-top lid keeps wipes moist and fresh, contains 768 wipes; The Free & Clear Baby Wipes are made from a fabric that is a blend of wood fiber, polypropylene and polyethylene.
Caring today for the next seven generations with Seventh Generation baby wipes

specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
